result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua B. Boehm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of DNA surcharge - work out payment with agent
Payment of DNA Surcharge on each count - work out payment with agent.
Not allowed to vote or sit on jury until civil rights are restored.

Remits all fines and costs.  Remain compliant with treatment and medications from treating provider.  Complete psychiatric evaluation within the first 60 days and comply with any and all treatment plans.  maintain/obtain full-time employment.  Pay not less than 25% of take home pay from any and all source of income against arrears each and every paycheck.  Completion of assessments, counseling and follow through as determined by agent.  Total and complete compliance with all Child Support Orders.  $500 bond on deposit shall be applied to arrears.  Provide DNA sample by 6/28/2018.  Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Credit for 80 days served - time served.
